person.persName: Levi Goodpaster (Bath County, Kentucky, merchant and banker)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, merchant and banker. Kentucky native. Married to Jane V. Allen Goodpaster in Nicholas County, Kentucky, on October 24, 1844. Father of Granville S. Goodpaster, Betty W. Goodpaster, Joseph Banks Goodpaster, Alexander Levi Goodpaster, Frank A. Goodpaster, Charles M. Goodpaster, Hoyt S. Goodpaster, William F. Goodpaster, and Benjamin M. Goodpaster. Merchant in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed William B. Arnold as a clerk in Bath County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Merchant in Bath County in 1860. Employed John E. Ewing as a clerk in Bath County in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved persons, including Sam, in Bath County in 1860. Merchant in Bath County in 1863. Banker in Bath County in 1865.
